intro: Lampropappus, commonly known as the silverleaf fleabane, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The leaves are typically silver or gray-green, covered in fine hairs that give them a distinctive appearance. These plants are native to North America and are often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and roadsides. Lampropappus species are generally herbaceous, with some species being annual or perennial.
